reasoning: Congenital condition with birth incidence estimated at 0.6-0.8% of male births (~4000 per 100k of all births). Based on pediatric endocrinology literature, though exact prevalence varies by population, ethnic background, and diagnostic criteria.
source: Conte FA et al. (1994). Congenital adrenal hyperplasia and related conditions. In: The Metabolic and Molecular Bases of Inherited Disease. McGraw-Hill.
